result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Bemus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing by his agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing by his agent.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with the Black River Falls Theisen's or Walmart.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Write a letter of apology to the victim.  Agent to pre-approve and determine if, and when, it should be sent to the victim.

Comply with medications and mental health programming.

Credit for 3 days, if revoked.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to start on or before November 11, 2015 at 6 pm.  Stay of sentence to be lifted immediately if he commits any new crimes.

supervisions.notes: A civil Judgment is granted for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

to defendant from Clerk.
With attachments from defendant requesting a hearing to address his jail credit.  (Sent to Judge on 5/10/16 to review)

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Osborne.  Parties have the revocation order and warrant.  No corrections noted by either party.  12CT56.  60 days jail. (time served)  13CM70- 2 counts.  6 mo jail, concurrent.  13CM73. 2 counts.  6 mo. jail, (135 days credit on the 13 cases).  15CM111. 9 mo jail concurrent.  15CM 18- 9 mo jail.  (94 days credit 15CM111 and 15CM18) .  15CM162 9 mo. jail .    15CT44 9 mo jail.  concurrent - 111 days credit.  Defense says 227 days credit due.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Defendant exercised his right to elocution.  

Court ordered:

12CT56-    60 days jail -  Credit for time served. Concurrent.
13CM70-    6   Months jail - Credit for 135 days. Concurrent.
13CM73-    6  Months jail - Credit for 135  days. Concurrent.
15CM18-    9  Months jail - Credit for 94 days. Concurrent.
15CM111-  9 Months jail - Credit for 94 days. Concurrent.
15CM162-  9 Months jail - Credit for 94 days. Concurrent.
15CT44-      9 Months jail - Credit for 111 days. Concurrent.

All to be served without EMP.  

Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-11-2016 01:30 pm
e-mailed to C.O. to schedule SEHR and Judge for review.
from DOC

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Stephanie Osborne. Victim notification complied with.  No restitution due.   Defendant plead guilty to the charges in the complaint..  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and entered his plea.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of the charges in the complaint.  State recommended 3 years probation with appropriate conditions.  No contact with Theisens.  Credit for 3 days, if revoked.  Not a joint recommendation. Defense recommended less probation.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.

Court ordered sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  Concurrent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, and DNA surcharge.  No contact with Theisens or Walmart in Black River Falls, WI.  AODA.  Subject to random testing.  s/m employment.  Comply with medications and mental health programming.  LOA to Theisens and Walmart.  Agent to pre-approve and determine if it should be sent to the victim.  Count 1, serve 20 days jail.  30 days to report 11/11/15 by 6 pm.  Stay to be lifted immediately if he commits any new crime.
